io.spine.server.entity

Class EntityLifecycleMonitor<I,E extends TransactionalEntity<I,S,B>,S extends com.google.protobuf.Message,B extends io.spine.validate.ValidatingBuilder<S,? extends com.google.protobuf.Message.Builder>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.entity.EntityLifecycleMonitor<I,E,S,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - ID type of the entity under transaction
    E - type of entity under transaction
    S - state type of the entity under transaction
    B - type of ValidatingBuilder of S
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionListener<I,E,S,B>

    @Internal
public final class EntityLifecycleMonitor<I,E extends TransactionalEntity<I,S,B>,S extends com.google.protobuf.Message,B extends io.spine.validate.ValidatingBuilder<S,? extends com.google.protobuf.Message.Builder>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements TransactionListener<I,E,S,B>
    An implementation of TransactionListener which monitors the transaction flow and triggers the EntityLifecycle.

    On a successful Transaction.Phase, memoizes the ID of the applied message. After a successful transaction commit, passes the memoized IDs to the EntityLifecycle of the entity under transaction, along with the information about the mutations performed under the transaction - an EntityRecordChange.

    An instance of this TransactionListener is meant to serve for a single Transaction. When trying to reuse a listener for multiple transactions, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

      • onAfterPhase

        public void onAfterPhase(Transaction.Phase<I,E,S,B> phase)
        A callback invoked after applying a transaction phase.

        This callback is invoked for both successfully applied and failed phases.

        Memoizes the ID of the event applied by the given phase. The received event IDs will be reported to the EntityLifecycle after a successful commit.

        Specified by:
        onAfterPhase in interface TransactionListener<I,E extends TransactionalEntity<I,S,B>,S extends com.google.protobuf.Message,B extends io.spine.validate.ValidatingBuilder<S,? extends com.google.protobuf.Message.Builder>>
        Parameters:
        phase - the phase which was applied before this callback is invoked
